```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```



```{r dataLoad}

## Read in Data

myCombinedData <- read.csv('Combined_Daily_Normals.csv')

# Print the structure of the dataframe
str(myCombinedData)

# Print the first few rows of the dataframe
head(myCombinedData)

myCombinedData %>% 
  select('STATION') %>% 
  n_distinct()


myCombinedData %>% 
  select('DailyStation') %>% 
  n_distinct() 

colSums(is.na(myCombinedData))
```


```{r checks}

duplicates <- myCombinedData %>%
  group_by(STATION, Date) %>%
  summarise(Count = n(), .groups = 'drop') %>%
  filter(Count > 1)

# Now find unique stations that have duplications
unique_duplicates <- duplicates %>%
  distinct(STATION) %>%
  arrange(STATION)

# Print the unique stations that have duplications
print(unique_duplicates)



# Filter for the specified stations
specified_stations <- c(72289523243, 72290023188, 74003503145, 74614023112, 74917100479, 99404199999)

filtered_data <- myCombinedData %>%
  filter(STATION %in% specified_stations, Date == "2014-02-01")

# Print the filtered data for examination
print(filtered_data)
```
